excerpt: Beachfront amusement & water park featuring various rides, slides, games & a Ferris wheel.
detail_description: Family Kingdom Amusement Park is a beachfront attraction in Myrtle Beach, offering a variety of rides, games, and a Ferris wheel. The park features 38 rides suitable for kids, families, and thrill-seekers alike. From classic wooden rollercoasters to modern swings and slingshots, there's something for everyone. Visitors can opt for unlimited ride wristbands or single ride tickets. With onsite parking available, the park provides a festive carnival atmosphere perfect for families and couples.
name: Family Kingdom Amusement Park
address: 300 4th Ave S, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

excerpt: Marine life attraction with kid-friendly exhibits & dive tours, plus live shows & a gift shop.
detail_description: Ripley's Aquarium of Myrtle Beach is an 85,000-square-foot marine life attraction located in the Broadway at the Beach entertainment complex. It offers a variety of kid-friendly exhibits, dive tours, live shows, and a gift shop. Visitors can immerse themselves in the depths of the ocean and encounter bizarre glowing jellyfish, sharp-toothed predators, quirky penguins, and mystical green sea turtles.
name: Ripley's Aquarium of Myrtle Beach
address: 1110 Celebrity Cir, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

excerpt: Riders take in coastline views from air-conditioned gondolas on this wheel that lights up nightly.
detail_description: Experience the breathtaking views of downtown Myrtle Beach from a new perspective at the SkyWheel Myrtle Beach. This iconic 187-foot-tall Ferris wheel offers 42 air-conditioned gondolas, providing riders with a bird's-eye view of the Atlantic Ocean, coastline, boardwalk, and downtown area. The nightly illumination adds to the enchanting experience as you take in the beauty of Myrtle Beach from high above during three revolutions that last about 10 minutes.
name: SkyWheel Myrtle Beach
address: 1110 N Ocean Blvd, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

detail_description: Broadway at the Beach is a renowned destination in Myrtle Beach, known for its entertainment and shopping options. This expansive 350-acre area has been a popular attraction since its establishment in 1995. Situated on Celebrity Circle, it offers a plethora of activities and retail opportunities at the heart of Myrtle Beach.
name: The beach
address: 3250 Nash St, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

excerpt: Spacious seasonal water park featuring 30+ rides from a 10-story water slide to a lazy river.
detail_description: Myrtle Waves Water Park is the largest water park in South Carolina, offering over 30 rides and attractions spread across its 20-acre space. Visitors can experience the thrill of towering water slides, relax in a massive wave pool, or enjoy a leisurely float along the 330,000-gallon lazy river. The park also features play areas for kids and amenities like picnic areas and dining options at Island Cafe and Sharkeys Snack Shack.
name: Myrtle Waves Water Park
address: 3000 Mr. Joe White Ave, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

excerpt: Daily performances of tunes from a variety of genres in a large theater boasting high-tech effects.
detail_description: Located in Myrtle Beach, The Carolina Opry Theater offers daily performances featuring a variety of music genres in a large theater with high-tech effects. Since its first show in 1986, it has become the premier entertainment destination in the area. With annual programs like The Christmas Show of the South and concerts from visiting stars, this 2,200-seat venue is a must-visit for live music enthusiasts.
name: The Carolina Opry Theater
address: 8901 N Kings Hwy, Myrtle Beach, SC 29572, USA

detail_description: The Myrtle Beach Pelicans is a minor league baseball team affiliated with the Chicago Cubs, offering game tickets starting at $8. They have various promotions on game days, such as BOGO hot dogs and $1 draft beers. Established in 1999, the team provides an enjoyable experience for both locals and tourists. The stadium is family-friendly with free parking and affordable seats at $20 per person.
name: Myrtle Beach Pelicans
address: 1251 21st Ave N, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

excerpt: Wooden pedestrian path with an oceanside park, retail shops, restaurants & summertime live music.
detail_description: The Myrtle Beach Boardwalk and Promenade is a charming wooden pathway that spans 1.2 miles along the oceanfront, offering a delightful mix of an oceanside park, retail shops, restaurants, and live music during the summer. Visitors can enjoy various attractions such as the SkyWheel Myrtle Beach, Nightmare Haunted House, and the Sling Shot Thrill Ride without paying an admission fee.
name: Myrtle Beach Boardwalk and Promenade
address: South Carolina 29577, USA

excerpt: Myrtle Beach, a city and vacation resort on South Carolina’s Atlantic coast, is the hub of the Grand Strand, a 60-mile string of beaches. It’s also known for its celebrity-designed golf courses. Along its beachfront boardwalk are arcades, souvenir stands and restaurants, as well as the old-fashioned Family Kingdom amusement park and the SkyWheel, one of the country’s tallest Ferris wheels.
detail_description: Myrtle Beach, located on the Atlantic coast of South Carolina, is a popular vacation destination known for its 60-mile stretch of beaches and celebrity-designed golf courses. The beachfront boardwalk offers arcades, souvenir stands, restaurants, an old-fashioned amusement park called Family Kingdom, and the SkyWheel Ferris wheel. Visitors can enjoy various activities such as surfing or relaxing by the private community pool.
name: Myrtle Beach
address: South Carolina, USA

excerpt: Sandy parkland offering recreational oceanfront, a nature center, forested areas & campgrounds.
detail_description: Myrtle Beach State Park is a serene coastal retreat located on the Grand Strand, offering a range of recreational activities and natural attractions. Visitors can enjoy fishing, swimming, camping, and picnicking amidst wide open beaches and an oceanfront maritime forest. The park also hosts various engaging programs such as shark truth discovery, sea turtle patrols, crab catching, snake feeding sessions, forest legends exploration, and more.
name: Myrtle Beach State Park
address: 4401 S Kings Hwy, Myrtle Beach, SC 29575, USA

excerpt: Attraction with 100+ hands-on science exhibits plus laser tag, a ropes course & a 6D motion ride.
detail_description: WonderWorks Myrtle Beach is an upside-down building at Broadway at the Beach that offers a unique blend of entertainment and education. It features over 100 hands-on exhibits, including a roller coaster simulator and adventure areas with laser tag and ropes courses. Visitors can enjoy interactive wonder zones that bring scientific concepts to life, such as the Bubble Lab and the Astronaut Training Gyro. The attraction also includes outdoor activities like a zip line and a three-level ropes course in the Soar + Explore area.
name: WonderWorks Myrtle Beach
address: 1313 Celebrity Cir, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

detail_description: Step back in time to the 11th century at Medieval Times Dinner & Tournament in Myrtle Beach. This immersive experience takes you to Her Majesty's Castle, where knights compete in jousting and sword fighting to protect the throne. Upon arrival, you'll be designated a knight to support with a specific colored crown. The evening begins with a Call to Table in the Grand Ceremonial Arena followed by a lavish four-course feast and an exhilarating two-hour tournament.
name: Medieval Times Dinner & Tournament
address: 2904 Fantasy Way, Myrtle Beach, SC 29579, USA

excerpt: A museum outpost featuring celebrity wax figures, a souvenir store, a zombie lab & a mirror maze.
detail_description: The Hollywood Wax Museum in Myrtle Beach is a fun and entertaining attraction that pays tribute to pop culture. This museum features lifelike wax figures of famous celebrities from the modern era of movies, music, TV, and sports. Visitors can take selfies with their favorite stars such as Marilyn Monroe, Justin Timberlake, and Katy Perry. The museum also offers a souvenir store, a zombie lab experience, and a mirror maze for added entertainment.
name: Hollywood Wax Museum
address: 1808 21st Ave N unit a, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

excerpt: Storefront shops open into an enclosed area with dining, movies, bowling, bike rentals & a theater.
detail_description: The Market Common in Myrtle Beach is a vibrant mixed-use neighborhood with a variety of shops, dining options, and entertainment. Situated on the former Air Force base grounds, this trendy area offers unique boutiques, bars, restaurants, and a movie theater. Throughout the year, visitors can enjoy free events such as Movies Under the Stars, art festivals, New Year's Eve celebrations, and complimentary carriage rides.
name: The Market Common - Myrtle Beach
address: 4017 Deville St, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

excerpt: Shopping-mall chain featuring a variety of brand-name & designer outlet stores.
detail_description: Tanger Outlets Myrtle Beach Hwy 501 is a shopper's paradise, offering an impressive selection of brand-name and designer outlet stores. Located conveniently along Highway 501, this vibrant shopping destination caters to every fashionista's needs with a diverse range of specialty shops. From trendy apparel at Adidas and Nine West Outlet to stylish accessories from Michael Kors and Ecco, you'll find everything you need for your beach getaway or everyday wear.
name: Tanger Outlets Myrtle Beach Hwy 501
address: 4635 Factory Stores Blvd, Myrtle Beach, SC 29579, USA

excerpt: Contemporary shopping center features popular chain retailers, restaurants & a movie theater.
detail_description: Located in Myrtle Beach, Coastal Grand Mall is a contemporary shopping center that offers a traditional mall experience with popular chain retailers, restaurants, and a movie theater. With over 100 well-known brand stores including anchor stores like Dick's Sporting Goods and Belk, it provides a wide variety of shopping options. The all-American food court is perfect for grabbing a mid-shopping snack, and the mall also offers extended holiday hours for last-minute gifts.
name: Coastal Grand Mall
address: 2000 Coastal Grand Cir, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

detail_description: Magic Shows by Michael Bairefoot at the GTS Theatre in Myrtle Beach is a world-famous and award-winning family-friendly comedy and magic show. The 1.5-hour event promises to thrill, amaze, and entertain audiences of all ages with classic tricks brought into the new age. The intimate setting of the theater ensures that there are no bad seats, allowing for an up-close experience with mind-blowing illusions and engaging performances.
name: Magic Shows by Michael Bairefoot
address: 3237 Waccamaw Blvd, Myrtle Beach, SC 29579, USA

detail_description: EdVenture Myrtle Beach is a fantastic destination designed to ignite the imaginations of children while providing an engaging learning experience. This vibrant museum features a variety of hands-on exhibits and programs that cater to kids of all ages, from sensory play areas to the exciting firefighting Dalmatian Station. Young explorers can dive into advanced STEM concepts through interactive displays, where they can climb aboard a spaceship, experiment at mission control, and even inspect an actual airplane engine!
name: EdVenture Myrtle Beach
address: 4005 Howard Ave, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

detail_description: New South Brewing, established in 1998 and known as the "Beer from here," is a hidden gem located in an industrial area of Myrtle Beach. The brewery offers tours, a tasting room, and retail sales, providing visitors with the opportunity to interact with passionate brewmasters.
name: New South Brewing
address: 1109 Campbell St, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

excerpt: Museum with kitschy oddities on display, including shrunken human heads & rare animal skeletons.
detail_description: Ripley's Believe It or Not! is a museum filled with quirky and unusual exhibits, such as shrunken human heads and rare animal skeletons. At the Ripley's Aquarium in Myrtle Beach, visitors can experience the thrill of traveling through the 750,000-gallon Dangerous Reef tunnel on a moving glide path surrounded by giant sharks up to 10 feet in length.
name: Ripley's Believe It or Not!
address: 901 N Ocean Blvd, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA
